title: Mariner 6
overview: Mariner 6 was a NASA mission launched on February 24, 1969, as part of the Mariner program, a series of spacecraft designed to explore the planets of the outer Solar System. The mission aimed to study the planet Mars and its atmosphere, with a focus on gathering data on the Martian surface and atmospheric composition. As a flyby mission, Mariner 6 flew within 2,190 miles of Mars' surface, providing valuable information about the planet's geology and climate. This mission was a significant step in NASA's exploration of the Solar System, providing crucial data that helped lay the groundwork for future Mars missions.

stories.title: 50 Years Ago: Mariner 6 and 7 Explore Mars
